title: Tottenham will target Real Madrid's Spain forward Isco if they sell Christian Eriksen
text:
Tottenham Hotspur are monitoring a swoop for Real Madrid's Isco in January as a potential replacement for wantaway midfielder Christian Eriksen.

Despite being one of the key players at White Hart Lane, the Dane is out of contract at the end of the season and Spurs are keen to cash in during the January window to help fund a replacement.

Tottenham have not given up hope of keeping Eriksen, and are prepared to offer him a £230,000-a-week deal to try and convince him to stay at the club.

Real Madrid forward Isco is being prepared as a replacement for Christian Eriksen by Spurs

Real Madrid were among the sides to have shown an interest in the summer but they along with many other clubs in Europe decided against following up with a bid due to Tottenham's demands of nearly £100m for the player.

However Spurs would likely accept a much smaller fee in January and Madrid may make a move for the player, which could also trigger a Spurs approach for Isco according to El Desmarque.

Isco has previously been a Tottenham target but could be more open to a move to the north London side if his place at Madrid becomes seriously under threat.

Eriksen is out of contract at the end of the season and Tottenham may cash in on a January sale

The Spain international has played just three times for Madrid this term and is yet to complete 90 minutes this campaign.

However, he has been ruled out for six games across all competitions relating to a muscle injury in his arm.

But Zinedine Zidane will not stand in his way if Isco decides to leave in the winter and the 27-year-old could be part of a clearout at the club.

Lucas Vazquez is another player who could depart the Spanish giants, with Arsenal among potential suitors. However it is Bayer Leverkusen who are thought to be leading the race for the forward.
